bitfield.description: VLCD to DSP Interrupt

\hVLCD Go
Write:
 0: Not used (do not write 0)
 1: Start VLCD module
Read:
 0: Idle
 1: Busy

Writing '1' starts the VLCD module. Reading provides VLCD execution status.
Round control for MPEG_INVQ
\hSpecify number of 8x8 blocks to process\nNumber of blocks can be 1 through 6.
\hJPEG Sync Insertion\n\nWriting '1' enables inserting 00 byte after FF byte
MPEG Picture Coding Type
Scan Mode (VLC/VLD)
\hIntra Macro Block Select\n\nSelects whether blocks are encoded as Intra Macro blocks

bitenum.description: Intra macro block (Set to '1' in JPEG mode)

bitfield.description: MPEG Intra VLC Format
Codec Mode Select
Quantization type for Encode and Decode in MPEG4
Function Select
Reserved\nmust not set to 1
Start address of input data used for Quantization
Reserved\nmust not set to 1
Start address of output data used for Quantization
Reserved\nmust not set to 1
Start address of input data used for inverse quantization
Reserved\nmust not set to 1
Start address of output data used for inverse quantization
Reserved\nmust not set to 1
Start address of input data used for VLC/VLD
Reserved\nmust not set to 1
\hStart address of output data used for VLC/VLD\n\nWhen VLD, the address should be 32bit aligned.
Initial/final DC predictors for quantization
Initial/final DC predictors for quantization
Initial/final DC predictors for quantization
Initial/final DC predictors for quantization
Initial/final DC predictors for quantization
Initial/final DC predictors for quantization
Initial/final DC predictors for inverse quantization
Initial/final DC predictors for inverse quantization
Initial/final DC predictors for inverse quantization
Initial/final DC predictors for inverse quantization
Initial/final DC predictors for inverse quantization
Initial/final DC predictors for inverse quantization
2^15/quant_scale for MPEG quantization
quant_scale for MPEG de-quantization
Number of delta value for use in MPEG quantization (2's compliment)
Number of delta value for use in MPEG inverse quantization (2's compliment)
Number of threds value for use in MPEG Quantization
\hCBP Detection Control

\hCoded block pattern \nIndicates at least one nonzero in a block. \nFor the standard six block macro block, CBP of the first block would be in bit position five. The second block's CBP bit in position 4, down to the last block being in bit position 0.

\hLuma Bit Vector\nSetting this bit high indicates that block has luminance data. For the standard six block macro block, the first block's Luma bit would be in bit position five. The second block's coded bit in position 4, down to the last block being in bit position 0.

register.description: Huffman DC Y Table Base Address Register

bitfield.description: \hBase address for Huffman DC Y tables\nShould be even (32-bit aligned).

register.description: Huffman DC UV Table Base Address Register

bitfield.description: \hBase address for Huffman DC UV tables \nShould be even (32-bit aligned).

register.description: Huffman AC0 Table Base Address Register

bitfield.description: \hBase address for Huffman AC0 tables \nShould be even (32-bit aligned).

register.description: Huffman AC1 Table Base Address Register

bitfield.description: \hBase address for Huffman AC1 tables \nShould be even (32-bit aligned).

register.description: MPEG Max 0 Level Table Base Address Register

bitfield.description: \hBase address for MPEG max 0 level tables \nShould be even (32-bit aligned).

register.description: MPEG Max 1 Level Table Base Address Register

bitfield.description: \hBase address for MPEG max 1 level tables \nShould be even (32-bit aligned).

register.description: DC Y Control Lookup Table Base Address Register

bitfield.description: \hControl Table DC Y pointer \nAddress pointer to the starting word of the Control Table DC Y lookup table in VLCD Huffman memory used by the UVLD. \nThis table shall start on a 32 bit word boundary.

register.description: DC UV Control Lookup Table Base Address Register

bitfield.description: \hControl Table DC UV pointer \nAddress pointer to the starting word of the Control Table DC UV lookup table in VLCD Huffman memory used by the UVLD. \nThis table shall start on a 32 bit word boundary.

register.description: AC0 Control Lookup Table Base Address Register

bitfield.description: \hControl Table DC AC0 pointer \nAddress pointer to the starting word of the Control Table DC AC0 lookup table in VLCD Huffman memory used by the UVLD. \nThis table shall start on a 32 bit word boundary.

register.description: AC1 Control Lookup Table Base Address Register

bitfield.description: \hControl Table DC AC1 pointer \nAddress pointer to the starting word of the Control Table DC AC1 lookup table in VLCD Huffman memory used by the UVLD. \nThis table shall start on a 32 bit word boundary.

register.description: DC Y Symbol Lookup Table Address Offset Register

bitfield.description: \hSymbol Table DC Y offset \nUsed to address the Symbol Table DC Y lookup table. The purpose of this offset is to avoid negative numbers being used in the Control table.

register.description: DC UV Symbol Lookup Table Address Offset Register

bitfield.description: \hSymbol Table DC UV offset \nUsed to address the Symbol Table DC UV lookup table. The purpose of this offset is to avoid negative numbers being used in the Control table.

register.description: AC0 Symbol Lookup Table Address Offset Register

bitfield.description: \hSymbol Table AC0 offset \nUsed to address the Symbol Table AC0 lookup table. The purpose of this offset is to avoid negative numbers being used in the Control table.

register.description: AC1 Symbol Lookup Table Address Offset Register

bitfield.description: \hSymbol Table AC1 offset \nUsed to address the Symbol Table AC1 lookup table. The purpose of this offset is to avoid negative numbers being used in the Control table.

register.description: DC Y Symbol Lookup Table Base Address Register

bitfield.description: \hSymbol Table DC Y pointer \nAddress pointer to the starting word of the Symbol Table DC Y lookup table in VLCD Huffman memory used by the UVLD. \nThis table shall start on a 32 bit word boundary.

register.description: DC UV Symbol Lookup Table Base Address Register

bitfield.description: \hSymbol Table DC UV pointer \nAddress pointer to the starting word of the Symbol Table DC UV lookup table in VLCD Huffman memory used by the UVLD. \nThis table shall start on a 32 bit word boundary.

register.description: AC0 Symbol Lookup Table Base Address Register

bitfield.description: \hSymbol Table AC0 pointer \nAddress pointer to the starting word of the Symbol Table AC0 lookup table in VLCD Huffman memory used by the UVLD. \nThis table shall start on a 32 bit word boundary.

register.description: AC1 Symbol Lookup Table Base Address Register

bitfield.description: \hSymbol Table AC1 pointer \nAddress pointer to the starting word of the Symbol Table AC1 lookup table in VLCD Huffman memory used by the UVLD. \nThis table shall start on a 32 bit word boundary.
\hSelect UVLD algorithm
\hThis bit signifies that the UVLD is expecting a 1 leading Huffman Table for the DC Y Tables
\hThis bit signifies that the UVLD is expecting a 1 leading Huffman Table for the DC UV Tables
\hThis bit signifies that the UVLD is expecting a 1 leading Huffman Table for the AC 0 Tables
\hThis bit signifies that the UVLD is expecting a 1 leading Huffman Table for the AC 1 Tables
\hDC Y Symbol Length \nBit length of the decoded symbol in the DC Y Symbol Table.
\hDC UV Symbol Length \nBit length of the decoded symbol in the DC UV Symbol Table.
\hAC0 Symbol Length \nBit length of the decoded symbol in the AC 0 Symbol Table.
\hAC1 Symbol Length \nBit length of the decoded symbol in the AC 1 Symbol Table.
Number of bits to test for the DC Y term as input to the UVLD
Number of bits to test for the DC UV term as input to the UVLD
Number of bits to test for the AC0 term as input to the UVLD
Number of bits to test for the AC1 term as input to the UVLD

\hNumber of valid bits in the 16-bit word pointed by VLCDOUT_ADDR(VLC) or VLCDIN_ADDR(VLD). 
Value = 0..15 
example: 
BPTR = 5 
 b15 b0 
BITS_WORD = VVVVV * * * * * * * * * * *
Last Bitstream at VLCDOUT_ADDR(VLC) or VLCDIN_ADDR(VLD).

\hByte Align 
VLC:
When set to '1' , enables byte alignment in current processing macro block
VLD:
When set to '1' , it means current processing bistream is byte aligned.

\hByte Align Fill value 
VLC:
When byte align is selected, last byte is filled with this bit. 
VLD:
No meaning
\hHeader Base \nBase address for header data to be inserted \nShould be even (32-bit aligned).
\hNumber of header data to be inserted(1-1023).
Scan Mode (VLC/VLD)
Quant matrix selector (1 of 8 banks)
Inverse Quantization matrix selector (1 of 8 banks)
DC predictor selector (1 of 6)
Scan Mode (VLC/VLD)
Quant matrix selector (1 of 8 banks)
Inverse Quantization matrix selector (1 of 8 banks)
DC predictor selector (1 of 6)
Scan Mode (VLC/VLD)
Quant matrix selector (1 of 8 banks)
Inverse Quantization matrix selector (1 of 8 banks)
DC predictor selector (1 of 6)
Scan Mode (VLC/VLD)
Quant matrix selector (1 of 8 banks)
Inverse Quantization matrix selector (1 of 8 banks)
DC predictor selector (1 of 6)
Scan Mode (VLC/VLD)
Quant matrix selector (1 of 8 banks)
Inverse Quantization matrix selector (1 of 8 banks)
DC predictor selector (1 of 6)
Scan Mode (VLC/VLD)
Quant matrix selector (1 of 8 banks)
Inverse Quantization matrix selector (1 of 8 banks)
DC predictor selector (1 of 6)

\hEOB Error Control

When an error occurs, stop huffman decoding
Error occurs when EOB cannot be found during VLD

\hUVLD Error Control

When an error occurs, stop huffman decoding.
Error occurs when at least one out of table entry found in macro block
\hRingbuffer over flow status\nThis bit shows that ring pointer reached at max address.
\hEOB Error

bitenum.description: can't find the EOB in VLD

bitfield.description: \hVLD Error

bitenum.description: found at least one non-FF00 code in macro block

bitfield.description: \hUVLD Error

bitenum.description: found at least 1 out of table entry in macro block

bitfield.description: \hRing buffer start address.\nVLC: When output pointer reaches end address, output pointer starts at start address automatically.\nVLD: When input pointer reaches end address, input pointer starts at start pointer automatically.

\hRing buffer end address.\nVLC: When output pointer reaches end address, output pointer starts at start address automatically.\nVLD: When input pointer reaches end address, input pointer starts at start pointer automatically.
\hEndian Control for VLD/VLC

bitenum.description: Fixed to little endian for DaVinci

bitfield.description: \hVLD Algorithm Selection
\hAdditional MPEG-4 Mode \nThis register active only when MODE:MODESEL is set to MPEG-4
\hScan Mode

bitenum.description: SCAN type is selected by VLCD_MODE(9:8)
SCAN type is selected by QIQ_CONFIG1 to 5

bitfield.description: \hMPEG2 Mode Select \nThis register only active when MODE:MODESEL is set to MPEG1
\hMPEG4 Escape Coding
\hDynamic Clock Control
\hNumber of prefix bits of control table for DC_Y term as input to UVLD
\hNumber of prefix bits of control table for DC_UV term as input to UVLD
\hNumber of prefix bits of control table for AC0 term as input to UVLD
\hNumber of prefix bits of control table for AC1 term as input to UVLD
\hNumber of symbols in a block
WMV9 Scan Table
Setting '1' specifies PQUANT>=8, I-frame andand no m_bDQuant
Quantization Scale
\hIntra Frame Rate Type
\hInter Frame Rate Type
\hAction for first frame \nSetting '1' specifies the first case of escape mode 3 in a frame. \nThis register is cleared when found a ESCAPE3(WMV9)
\hIQ Mode
\hH264 Scan Table Enable
\hCAVLD Enable

\hThreshold level of NRBITS (number of bits) in WMV9 decoding \nWhen the NRBITS from Huffman table is greater than this threshold value, UVLD error happens. Current VLD algorithm defines the maximum NRBITS as 6. No need to modify the default value.
